thread.title: Nintendo Switch will launch 3rd March for £279.99
thread.title_full: Nintendo Switch will launch 3rd March for £279.99

title: Nintendo Switch will launch 3rd March for £279.99
text:
Nintendo Switch will launch 3rd March for £279.99 No region locking, online service free until autumn. By Jeffrey Matulef Published 13/01/2017 
UPDATE: Nintendo has announced the UK price of the Switch, and it's come in higher than a lot of people had hoped for. 
Nintendo said the Switch costs £279.99 in the UK. Blame Brexit? #NintendoSwitch arrives on March 3rd 2017 and will be Â£279.99 on the Nintendo Official UK Store. — Nintendo UK (@NintendoUK) January 13, 2017 
The Nintendo Switch will be out on 3rd March in "major EU countries", US, Canada, Japan, Hong Kong and other territories, Nintendo announced at its reveal event this morning. 
It will cost $299.99 in North America, ¥29,980 in Japan, and we're told to "Please check local retailers" in Europe. 
Nintendo confirmed that its online service will be free until autumn, then it will require a paid subscription. 
There will be no region locking on the system. 
Other details: It will allow up to eight systems to sync for local multiplayer, features a capacitive touch screen, and the battery life will last roughly 2.5-6.5 hours, but you can play while charging the system should it be plugged in. Sometimes we include links to online retail stores. If you click on one and make a purchase we may receive a small commission. For more information, go here . About Jeffrey Matulef 
Jeffrey Matulef is the best-dressed man in 1984. Based in Portland, OR he operates as Eurogamer's US news editor.
